This section specifies the loaded data formats.
The following fields are guaranteed. Additionally, the loaded tileset object will contain all the data fetched from the provided url.
. Indicates the returned object is an
Root's level of detail (LoD) metric type, which is used to decide if a tile is sufficient for current viewport. Only support
Root's level of detail (LoD) metric value.
The following fields are guaranteed. Additionally, the loaded tile object will contain all the data fetched from the provided url.
A bounding volume in Cartesian coordinates converted from i3s node's
that encloses a tile or its content. Exactly one box, region, or sphere property is required.
Level of Detail (LoD) metric type, which is used to decide if a tile is sufficient for current viewport. Only support

An array of objects that define child tiles. Each child tile content is fully enclosed by its parent tile's bounding volume and, generally, has more details than parent. for leaf tiles, the length of this array is zero, and children may not be defined.
The actual payload of the tile or the url point to the actual payload. If
is enabled, content will be populated with the loaded value following the Tile Content section
Identifier of the tile, unique in a tileset
Refinement type of the tile, currently only support
Type of the tile, value is
After content is loaded, the following fields are guaranteed. But different tiles may have different extra content fields.
"Center" of tile geometry in WGS84 fixed frame coordinates
"Origin" in lng/lat (center of tile's bounding volume)
Transforms tile geometry positions to fixed frame coordinates
Transforms tile geometry positions to fixed frame coordinates
Loaded feature data for parsing the geometies (Will be deprecated in 2.x)
